verses.verse: Then all Israel<WH3478> gathered<WH6908> themselves to David<WH1732> unto Hebron<WH2275>, saying<WH559>, Behold, we are thy bone<WH6106> and thy flesh<WH1320>.

And moreover in time<WH8543> past<WH8032>, even when Saul<WH7586> was king<WH4428>, thou wast he that leddest out<WH3318> and broughtest in<WH935> Israel<WH3478>: and the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> said<WH559> unto thee, Thou shalt feed<WH7462> my people<WH5971> Israel<WH3478>, and thou shalt be ruler<WH5057> over my people<WH1571> Israel<WH3478>. in time: Heb. both yesterday and the third day feed: or, rule

Therefore came<WH935> all the elders<WH2205> of Israel<WH3478> to the king<WH4428> to Hebron<WH2275>; and David<WH1732> made<WH3772> a covenant<WH1285> with them in Hebron<WH2275> before<WH6440> the LORD<WH3068>; and they anointed<WH4886> David<WH1732> king<WH4428> over Israel<WH3478>, according to the word<WH1697> of the LORD<WH3068> by<WH3027> Samuel<WH8050>. by: Heb. by the hand of
And David<WH1732> and all Israel<WH3478> went<WH3212> to Jerusalem<WH3389>, which is Jebus<WH2982>; where the Jebusites<WH2983> were, the inhabitants<WH3427> of the land<WH776>.

And the inhabitants<WH3427> of Jebus<WH2982> said<WH559> to David<WH1732>, Thou shalt not come<WH935> hither. Nevertheless David<WH1732> took<WH3920> the castle<WH4686> of Zion<WH6726>, which is the city<WH5892> of David<WH1732>.

And David<WH1732> said<WH559>, Whosoever smiteth<WH5221> the Jebusites<WH2983> first<WH7223> shall be chief<WH7218> and captain<WH8269>. So Joab<WH3097> the son<WH1121> of Zeruiah<WH6870> went<WH5927> first<WH7223> up<WH5927>, and was chief<WH7218>. chief: Heb. head
And David<WH1732> dwelt<WH3427> in the castle<WH4679>; therefore they called<WH7121> it the city<WH5892> of David<WH1732>. it: that is, Zion
And he built<WH1129> the city<WH5892> round about<WH5439>, even from Millo<WH4407> round about<WH5439>: and Joab<WH3097> repaired<WH2421> the rest<WH7605> of the city<WH5892>. repaired: Heb. revived
So David<WH1732> waxed<WH3212> greater<WH1980> and greater<WH1419>: for the LORD<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635> was with him. waxed: Heb. went in going and increasing

These also are the chief<WH7218> of the mighty men<WH1368> whom David<WH1732> had, who strengthened<WH2388> themselves with him in his kingdom<WH4438>, and with all Israel<WH3478>, to make him king<WH4427>, according to the word<WH1697> of the LORD<WH3068> concerning Israel<WH3478>. strengthened: or, held strongly with him

And this is the number<WH4557> of the mighty men<WH1368> whom David<WH1732> had; Jashobeam<WH3434>, an Hachmonite<WH2453>, the chief<WH7218> of the captains<WH7991> <WH7970>: he lifted up<WH5782> his spear<WH2595> against three<WH7969> hundred<WH3967> slain<WH2491> by him at one<WH259> time<WH6471>. an Hachmonite: or, son of Hachmoni
And after<WH310> him was Eleazar<WH499> the son<WH1121> of Dodo<WH1734>, the Ahohite<WH266>, who was one of the three<WH7969> mighties<WH1368>.

He was with David<WH1732> at Pasdammim<WH6450>, and there the Philistines<WH6430> were gathered together<WH622> to battle<WH4421>, where was a parcel<WH2513> of ground<WH7704> full<WH4392> of barley<WH8184>; and the people<WH5971> fled<WH5127> from before<WH6440> the Philistines<WH6430>. Pasdammim: also called, Ephesdammim I. Sam.17.1.

And they set<WH3320> themselves in the midst<WH8432> of that parcel<WH2513>, and delivered<WH5337> it, and slew<WH5221> the Philistines<WH6430>; and the LORD<WH3068> saved<WH3467> them by a great<WH1419> deliverance<WH8668>. set: or, stood deliverance: or, salvation

Now three<WH7969> of the thirty<WH7970> captains<WH7218> went down<WH3381> to the rock<WH6697> to David<WH1732>, into the cave<WH4631> of Adullam<WH5725>; and the host<WH4264> of the Philistines<WH6430> encamped<WH2583> in the valley<WH6010> of Rephaim<WH7497>. three: or, three captains over the thirty
And David<WH1732> was then in the hold<WH4686>, and the Philistines'<WH6430> garrison<WH5333> was then at Bethlehem<WH1035>.
And David<WH1732> longed<WH183>, and said<WH559>, Oh that one would give me drink<WH8248> of the water<WH4325> of the well<WH953> of Bethlehem<WH1035>, that is at the gate<WH8179>!

And the three<WH7969> brake through<WH1234> the host<WH4264> of the Philistines<WH6430>, and drew<WH7579> water<WH4325> out of the well<WH953> of Bethlehem<WH1035>, that was by the gate<WH8179>, and took<WH5375> it, and brought<WH935> it to David<WH1732>: but David<WH1732> would<WH14> not drink<WH8354> of it, but poured it out<WH5258> to the LORD<WH3068>,

And said<WH559>, My God<WH430> forbid<WH2486> it me, that I should do<WH6213> this thing<WH2063>: shall I drink<WH8354> the blood<WH1818> of these men<WH582> that have put their lives in jeopardy<WH5315>? for with the jeopardy of their lives<WH5315> they brought<WH935> it. Therefore he would<WH14> not drink<WH8354> it. These things did<WH6213> these three<WH7969> mightiest<WH1368>. that have: Heb. with their lives?

And Abishai<WH52> the brother<WH251> of Joab<WH3097>, he was chief<WH7218> of the three<WH7969>: for lifting up<WH5782> his spear<WH2595> against three<WH7969> hundred<WH3967>, he slew<WH2491> them, and had a name<WH8034> among the three<WH7969>.
Of the three<WH7969>, he was more honourable<WH3513> than the two<WH8147>; for he was their captain<WH8269>: howbeit he attained<WH935> not to the first three<WH7969>.

Benaiah<WH1141> the son<WH1121> of Jehoiada<WH3077>, the son<WH1121> of a valiant<WH2428> man<WH376> of Kabzeel<WH6909>, who had done many<WH7227> acts<WH6467>; he slew<WH5221> two<WH8147> lionlike men<WH739> of Moab<WH4124>: also he went down<WH3381> and slew<WH5221> a lion<WH738> in<WH8432> a pit<WH953> in a snowy<WH7950> day<WH3117>. who had: Heb. great of deeds

And he slew<WH5221> an Egyptian<WH4713>, a man<WH376> of great stature<WH4060>, five<WH2568> cubits<WH520> high; and in the Egyptian's<WH4713> hand<WH3027> was a spear<WH2595> like a weaver's<WH707> beam<WH4500>; and he went down<WH3381> to him with a staff<WH7626>, and plucked<WH1497> the spear<WH2595> out of the Egyptian's<WH4713> hand<WH3027>, and slew<WH2026> him with his own spear<WH2595>. great: Heb. measure
These things did<WH6213> Benaiah<WH1141> the son<WH1121> of Jehoiada<WH3077>, and had the name<WH8034> among the three<WH7969> mighties<WH1368>.
Behold<WH2009>, he was honourable<WH3513> among the thirty<WH7970>, but attained<WH935> not to the first three<WH7969>: and David<WH1732> set<WH7760> him over his guard<WH4928>.
Also the valiant men<WH1368> of the armies<WH2428> were, Asahel<WH6214> the brother<WH251> of Joab<WH3097>, Elhanan<WH445> the son<WH1121> of Dodo<WH1734> of Bethlehem<WH1035>,
Shammoth<WH8054> the Harorite<WH2033>, Helez<WH2503> the Pelonite<WH6397>, Shammoth: or, Shammah Harorite: or, Harodite Pelonite: or, Paltite
Ira<WH5896> the son<WH1121> of Ikkesh<WH6142> the Tekoite<WH8621>, Abiezer<WH44> the Antothite<WH6069>,
Sibbecai<WH5444> the Hushathite<WH2843>, Ilai<WH5866> the Ahohite<WH266>, Sibbecai: or, Mebunnai Ilai: or, Zalmon
Maharai<WH4121> the Netophathite<WH5200>, Heled<WH2466> the son<WH1121> of Baanah<WH1196> the Netophathite<WH5200>, Heled: or, Heleb
Ithai<WH863> the son<WH1121> of Ribai<WH7380> of Gibeah<WH1390>, that pertained to the children<WH1121> of Benjamin<WH1144>, Benaiah<WH1141> the Pirathonite<WH6553>,
Hurai<WH2360> of the brooks<WH5158> of Gaash<WH1608>, Abiel<WH22> the Arbathite<WH6164>, Hurai: or, Hiddai Abiel: or, Abialbon
Azmaveth<WH5820> the Baharumite<WH978>, Eliahba<WH455> the Shaalbonite<WH8170>,
The sons<WH1121> of Hashem<WH2044> the Gizonite<WH1493>, Jonathan<WH3129> the son<WH1121> of Shage<WH7681> the Hararite<WH2043>, Hashem: or, Jashen
Ahiam<WH279> the son<WH1121> of Sacar<WH7940> the Hararite<WH2043>, Eliphal<WH465> the son<WH1121> of Ur<WH218>, Sacar: or, Sharar Eliphal: or, Eliphelet Ur: or, Ahasbai
Hepher<WH2660> the Mecherathite<WH4382>, Ahijah<WH281> the Pelonite<WH6397>,
Hezro<WH2695> the Carmelite<WH3761>, Naarai<WH5293> the son<WH1121> of Ezbai<WH229>,
Joel<WH3100> the brother<WH251> of Nathan<WH5416>, Mibhar<WH4006> the son<WH1121> of Haggeri<WH1905>, the son: or, the Haggerite
Zelek<WH6768> the Ammonite<WH5984>, Naharai<WH5171> the Berothite<WH1307>, the armourbearer<WH5375> <WH3627> of Joab<WH3097> the son<WH1121> of Zeruiah<WH6870>,
Ira<WH5896> the Ithrite<WH3505>, Gareb<WH1619> the Ithrite<WH3505>,
Uriah<WH223> the Hittite<WH2850>, Zabad<WH2066> the son<WH1121> of Ahlai<WH304>,
Adina<WH5721> the son<WH1121> of Shiza<WH7877> the Reubenite<WH7206>, a captain<WH7218> of the Reubenites<WH7206>, and thirty<WH7970> with him,
Hanan<WH2605> the son<WH1121> of Maachah<WH4601>, and Joshaphat<WH3146> the Mithnite<WH4981>,
Uzzia<WH5814> the Ashterathite<WH6254>, Shama<WH8091> and Jehiel<WH3273> the sons<WH1121> of Hothan<WH2369> the Aroerite<WH6200>,
Jediael<WH3043> the son<WH1121> of Shimri<WH8113>, and Joha<WH3109> his brother<WH251>, the Tizite<WH8491>, son: or, Shimrite
Eliel<WH447> the Mahavite<WH4233>, and Jeribai<WH3403>, and Joshaviah<WH3145>, the sons<WH1121> of Elnaam<WH493>, and Ithmah<WH3495> the Moabite<WH4125>,
Eliel<WH447>, and Obed<WH5744>, and Jasiel<WH3300> the Mesobaite<WH4677>.
